FuncDef:
The lacp dampening unexpected-mac disable command disables MAC address flapping suppression in Ethernet headers of LACPDUs.
The undo lacp dampening unexpected-mac disable command restores the default configuration. The lacp dampening unexpected-mac disable command disables MAC address flapping suppression in Ethernet headers of LACPDUs. The undo lacp dampening unexpected-mac disable command restores the default configuration. By default, MAC address flapping suppression in Ethernet headers of LACPDUs is enabled.
ExtraInfo: By default, an Eth-Trunk interface in LACP mode is enabled to suppress invalid MAC addresses in Ethernet headers of received LACPDUs from flapping, in which case the source MAC addresses of the LACPDUs and system ID are checked. To disable the check, run the lacp dampening unexpected-mac disable command to disable MAC address flapping suppression in Ethernet headers of LACPDUs.
